thread.title: Colby Lewis Bids Farewell To The Rangers & Their Fans
thread.title_full: Colby Lewis Bids Farewell To The Rangers & Their Fans

author: CBS Dallas / Fort Worth
title: Colby Lewis Bids Farewell To The Rangers & Their Fans
text:
Colby Lewis Bids Farewell To The Rangers & Their Fans February 14, 2017 10:17 AM Filed Under: colby lewis , Texas Rangers ARLINGTON, TX - APRIL 19: Colby Lewis #48 of the Texas Rangers pitches against the Chicago White Sox during the first inning on April 19, 2014 at Globe Life Park in Arlington, Texas. (Photo by Cooper Neill/Getty Images) Colby Lewis #48 of the Texas Rangers pitches against the Chicago White Sox during the first inning on April 19, 2014 at Globe Life Park in Arlington, Texas. (Photo by Cooper Neill/Getty Images) 
Follow The Fan: Facebook | Twitter 
DALLAS (105.3 The Fan) – Free agent pitcher Colby Lewis, who spent nine of his 11 years in Texas, said goodbye to the club and their fans on Tuesday. 
In a statement to Emily Jones of Fox Sports Southwest, Lewis didn’t specify whether he was walking away from the game or just won’t be pitching in Texas next season. 
“Just saying “thank you,” doesn’t seem adequate, but thank you. From my family and me, thank you for the countless memories, unbelievable heights reached, and for making me feel like I will always have a home in Texas,” Lewis said. I will always be grateful for my time with the Lewises. All of them. Here's Colby's statement. pic.twitter.com/r74kKvub2l 
— Emily Jones (@EmilyJonesMcCoy) February 14, 2017 
The 37-year-old went 77-72 with a 4.70 ERA in his career with Texas, Detroit and Oakland.
